MONTH DAY, YEAR Our transcription is based on a digital image of the original.
Case Papers
Civil
Petition for Freedom
MONTH YEAR
Transcribed, encoded.
Interrogations to the propounded to the Elroy Le Compte Francis Baptist Valle, Bartholomew Durreher and Joseph Bogy of the Lou of St. Genevieve and State of Missouri with helps to the produced sworn and examined in a certain cause at common law now pleading and undetermined in the United States district court for the County of Grant and territory of Wisconsin wherein Paul Jones a colored man is plantiff and George W. Jones is defendant on the part and in behalf of the laid defendant.
Interrogatory 1st Do you know the parties plaintiff and defendant in the title of these interrogations named or either of them and which of them and how long have you known them respectively?
2 Are you or either of you acquaintances with a colored man called Paul who was sold as a slave by Elroy LeCompte John H. LeCompte and S. LeCompte to the defendant George W. Jones. If so state all you know about the raid state and at what time it took place?
3 Do you or either of you know who was the mother of the said colored man Paul? Where did he reside by what name called whether she was not heed as a slave in the state of Illinois if so by what tennure or rights?
4 Do you or either of you know where and when the before named Paul was born if so please state?
5 Do you or either of you of you know whether the service Paul was held to service for life as a slave in Illinois under the laws and usages in force in the North Western territory now state of Illinois in favor of the ancient french and canadian inhabitants of the villages of Kaskaskia and Prarie Du Rocher Cahokia and other villages in the former NorthWestern territory now state of Illinois aforesaid if so please state all you know in relation to it as fully as if particularly interrogated there to?
6 Do you or either of you know whether the mothers of the said colored man Paul, was or was not on or before the 13th of July A.D. 1787 held and owned as a slave bound to the service to one of the Canadian or French inhabitants mentioned in the fifth interrogatory, if so please state what you know in relation to it?
7 Do you or either of you know whether the said Paul was a slave in the state of illinois according to any law or uasge then in force if is, state by whome held and by what right and tennure
8 Are you or either of you interested directly or indirectly in the event and termination of this suit?
9 Do you know anything further that may tend to the benefit and advantage of the defendant in this cause or the elucidation of this subject if so please state fully and particularly
George W. Jones by Hempstead & Dunn his attorney Examined & approved 6th, August 1840 Chas Dunn, Judge 1st, Jud: Dis: W.T.
